qas.question: What is Whitehead's most well-known critical statement regarding the Christian notion of God?

answers.text: "the Church gave unto God the attributes which belonged exclusively to Caesar."

qas.question: What qualities dis Whitehead state that Christians attributed to their version of God?

answers.text: primarily a divine king who imposes his will on the world, and whose most important attribute is power

qas.question: What was Whitehead's description of God?
What was Whitehead's description of The Devil?

plausible_answers.text: the Church gave unto God the attributes which belonged exclusively to Caesar

qas.question: What is Whitehead's least well-known critical statement regarding the Christian notion of God?

plausible_answers.text: primarily a divine king who imposes his will on the world, and whose most important attribute is power

qas.question: What qualities dis Whitehead not state that Christians attributed to their version of God?

context: Whitehead's idea of God differs from traditional monotheistic notions. Perhaps his most famous and pointed criticism of the Christian conception of God is that <a0_0>"<b4_0>the Church gave unto God the attributes which belonged exclusively to Caesar<b4_0/>."<a0_0/> Here Whitehead is criticizing Christianity for defining God as <a1_0><b5_0>primarily a divine king who imposes his will on the world, and whose most important attribute is power<b5_0/><a1_0/>. As opposed to the most widely accepted forms of Christianity, Whitehead emphasized an idea of God that he called <a2_0>"<b3_0>the brief Galilean<b3_0/> vision of humility"<a2_0/>:
